note.p: Burial: The middle of the choir of York Minster, York, Yorkshire
Education: Westminster School; Trinity College, Cambridge; BA (1658/98), MA (1662), BD and DD (1675); incorporated at Oxford (1669)

Career: Fellow of Trinity (1659); signed for priest's orders (1666); Vicar of Barrington, Cambridgeshire (1667); Regius Professor of Greek (1672); High Master of St Paul's (1672-1697); Prebendary of St Paul's (1676); Dean of York (1697-1702); friend and correspondent of Samuel Pepys (FRS 1665)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Hunter; Foster
